roleset.name: to make normal, standard, or consistent

example.name: transitive
example.text: The increased demand would normalize trading and stabilize prices .

roleset.note: NORMALIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'normalize' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from normalize.01-v predicate notes)
NORMALIZED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from normalized.01-j)

roleset.name: average, to be expected, abbreviation for "normal"

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 that is normal
specific measurement, numerical reading of normalcy

example.name: the arg
example.text: All nations have them and they all tend to be different -LRB- which [*] is normal considering different nations have different cultures , traditions and customs -RRB- , it just so happens that in Israel the requirement is that your mother is / was Jewish , it is different to requirments in other countries but it is no less valid .
example.arg: considering different nations have different cultures , traditions and customs -RRB-

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: Sensory examination is normal to fine touch , and proprioception .

example.name: abbreviation
example.text: O/P CL , Tongue NL , No Ulcers , Dentition is edentuous with dentures , Gums are good .

roleset.note: NORMAL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, relation to normalize.01. (from normal.01-j)
NML-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SHARP. (from nml.01-j)
NL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SHARP. (from nl.01-j)
Arg0 from the verb not included (from normal.01-j)
